dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 34/50, the charity shows high donor fit for those prioritizing global education and community support [3]. The organization facilitates sadaqah-eligible contributions to support its various religious and humanitarian programs [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The institute demonstrates a direct provision model by delivering educational services and humanitarian aid directly to beneficiaries [1]. While it reports a total revenue of $1,181,926 and a 100.0% program expense ratio, the overall impact score of 21/50 is limited by a lack of external evidence regarding long-term outcomes and low data confidence [1][2].

strengths_deep_dive: Najam Institute's financial model is characterized by extreme lean operations. According to its <cite id="2">2023 Form 990</cite>, the organization generated <cite id="2">$1,181,926 in revenue</cite> while maintaining <cite id="1">zero fundraising expenses</cite>. This efficiency is paired with a diverse program portfolio that includes the <cite id="3">Najam Seminary and Najam Academy</cite>, which provide <cite id="3">accessible classical Islamic education</cite> to the community. The organization also maintains <cite id="1">1.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing a stable buffer for its ongoing operations.
rich_narrative.summary: Based in Decatur, Georgia, Najam Institute Foundation Inc operates with a mission to provide <cite id="3">humanitarian help to families in need</cite> alongside <cite id="3">free classical Islamic knowledge</cite> through its specialized seminary and community programs. The organization manages several key initiatives, including the <cite id="3">Najam Seminary, Najam Academy, and Najam Center Decatur</cite>. Financially, the organization has seen explosive growth, reporting <cite id="2">$1,181,926 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 373.0%</cite>. A defining characteristic of Najam Institute is its fiscal lean nature; it reports a <cite id="1">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, meaning all functional expenses are directed toward its core mission of education and relief. Furthermore, the charity operates with <cite id="1">high fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending <cite id="1">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. While the organization maintains a <cite id="2">developing theory of change</cite>, it focuses on direct provision of services, including <cite id="3">flexible classical Islamic classes</cite> and local relief efforts through <cite id="3">Najam Relief</cite>.
